column4: spokesman for the Ministry of Health
column5: denied posts on social media that the fainting of a foreigner was caused by new coronary artery disease.------The spokesman for the Ministry of Health told local media that after medical examination of the victim
column6: he was not suffering from the virus. His fainting could only have been caused by the wind (k’jal
column7: a mysterious Cambodian ailment that can mean dizziness or a stroke). However
column9: who was reported to be a British Indian (*later reported as being from Yemen)
column10: was taken from the airport by ambulance at the Royal Hospital after fainting.------It was reported that at about 9:30 am on February 9
column11: the man fainted at the airport. Phnom Penh International Airport causing the false reports on Facebook. ------KBN
